modules.description: Generates a character mapping structure from a list of string pairs, enabling custom character replacements during text processing. It works with a type `t` that encapsulates these mappings, supporting locale-specific or user-defined transformations. Used to prepare replacement rules for slug generation, such as converting special characters to ASCII equivalents.

Provides mappings of language-specific slugs to their corresponding identifiers, using lists of string pairs. Works with language codes and their associated slug values. Used to translate between language identifiers and URL-friendly slugs in multilingual applications.

Converts strings into URL-safe slugs using a transformation algorithm that handles non-Latin characters and special symbols. Processes UTF-8 encoded strings and applies case normalization, character replacement, and hyphenation. Used to generate clean, readable URLs from titles or headings in web applications.

Generates URL-safe slugs by normalizing input, replacing special characters, and transforming whitespace. Uses a mapping type to define custom character substitutions and language-specific slug translations. Examples include converting "my string" to "my-string" or handling Vietnamese characters with locale-specific rules. Supports flexible configuration through user-defined charmaps and language code associations.
